alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:38PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Tolland, north central Hartford, southeastern Hampshire and south central Hampden Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Suffield, or near Agawam, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Chicopee, Enfield, Westfield, Holyoke, Windsor, Agawam, West Springfield, Simsbury, Ludlow, Bloomfield, South Hadley, Longmeadow, Suffield, East Longmeadow, Wilbraham, Windsor Locks, Somers, Granby and Southwick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
